Link Mash (March 20, 2014)

Mar 20, 2014
1 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

  • Nirvana. As much as I love Toodledo, its slow development cycle and stale UI leaves me wanting. This weekend, I discovered Nirvana. It’s too soon to tell, but I may be ditching my beloved Toodledo…
  • Make iTerm 2 More Mac-like. One long-standing issue I’ve had with iTerm 2 is the inability to press Command + Left and go to the beginning of the line (and other Mac items). Of course, there’s an answer for that.
  • Scatterbrains 3: a new tool for doing. I’m not sure how I would merge this idea into my workflow, but nonetheless, I love the idea of quick “what was I doing?” recall.
  • OneNote and Microsoft’s quiet API revolution. Microsoft releasing a free version of a product, making it cross-platform, and opening an API?! Evernote, beware.
  • Kill the DRM in Your Old iTunes Music Purchases. Way to go, Wired; yet again, you save the day.
Theme crafted with <3 by John Otander (@4lpine).
